data.title: Montenegro eVisa
data.meta_description: The Montenegro e Visa is an electronic travel authorization which is a 100% online process that hardly takes 3-5 minutes to fill in the online application.
data.text:
Traveling to Montenegro?

Montenegro is a small country located in Southeastern Europe. It is known for its beautiful beaches, historic towns, and stunning mountain scenery. To enter Montenegro, a valid passport is required for citizens of most countries. If you plan to stay for more than 90 days, you will also need to obtain a visa.

It is always a good idea to check the current visa and entry requirements before you travel, as they can change. Once you are in Montenegro, there are many options for transportation, including buses, trains, and rental cars. The official currency is the Euro.

Montenegro is a small country located in Southeastern Europe, bordered by Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Kosovo, and Albania. It has a population of about 622,000 people and its official language is Montenegrin. The country gained independence from Serbia in 2006, and is currently a candidate for membership in the European Union.

Montenegro is known for its beautiful beaches, historic towns, and stunning mountain scenery. The coastline of the country is about 293 km long, with many picturesque beaches and bays. The country also has several national parks, including Durmitor National Park, known for its ski resorts and hiking trails.

Tourism is an important industry in Montenegro, with many visitors attracted to its natural beauty, mild Mediterranean climate, and rich cultural heritage. Visitors can enjoy a variety of activities, including hiking, skiing, boating, and swimming. The country also has a vibrant nightlife, with many bars and nightclubs.

Montenegro e visa

Montenegro offers an e-Visa for certain nationalities. An e-Visa is an electronic visa that can be obtained online, rather than through a traditional paper application process. The e-Visa allows entry into Montenegro for tourism and business purposes. To apply for an e-Visa, you will need to have a valid passport, a digital passport-sized photo, and a credit or debit card to pay the visa fee. You will also need to provide some personal information, such as your name, date of birth, and contact information.

The e-visa is valid for 90 days, with a maximum stay of 30 days. The e-visa is Single Entry Visa.

It's important to note that not all nationalities are eligible for an e-Visa. You should check the official website of the Montenegrin Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration to see if your nationality is eligible for an e-Visa.

It's also important to note that, even though the e-Visa is electronic, you will still need to present a printed copy of the e-Visa at the border when entering Montenegro.

Difference Between Montenegro visa & Montenegro evisa

A Montenegro visa and a Montenegro eVisa are both documents that allow a person to enter and stay in the country for a specific period of time and for a specific purpose. The main difference between the two is how they are obtained.

Montenegro visa : A Montenegro visa is a traditional visa that is issued by the government of Montenegro through its embassies and consulates. The process of obtaining a traditional visa typically involves submitting an application and supporting documents in person or by mail, and waiting for the visa to be processed and issued.

Montenegro eVisa: A Montenegro eVisa, on the other hand, is an electronic visa that can be obtained online. The process of obtaining a eVisa typically involves filling out an online application, submitting a digital copy of the required documents, and paying the visa fee online. Once the application is approved, the eVisa is emailed to the applicant.

Note : In summary, the main difference between a Montenegro visa and a Montenegro eVisa is the way they are obtained. A Montenegro visa is obtained through the traditional way of submitting an application to the embassy or consulate and a Montenegro eVisa is obtained through an online application.

How Can I Apply for a Montenegro e-visa?

To apply for a Montenegro eVisa, you will need to follow these steps:

Check your eligibility: Before you apply for a Montenegro eVisa, you should check to see if you are eligible. Most nationalities are eligible for an eVisa, but there are some exceptions.

Gather the required documents: To apply for a Montenegro eVisa, you will need to provide certain documents, such as a passport, a recent passport-size photo, and proof of onward travel. You may also need to provide proof of accommodation and/or proof of sufficient funds.

Fill out the online application form: You will need to fill out the online application form, which will ask for personal and travel information, such as your name, date of birth, and the dates of your trip.

Pay the visa fee: Once you have completed the application form, you will need to pay the visa fee. The fee can be paid online using a credit or debit card.

Submit your application: Once you have paid the visa fee, you can submit your application, and attach required documents. You should receive a confirmation email once your application has been received.

Wait for approval: After submitting your application, you will need to wait for it to be processed. This can take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks. Once your application is approved, you will receive your eVisa by email.

Note : It is important to note that the process for obtaining a Montenegro eVisa can vary depending on the nationality of the applicant and the purpose of their travel. It is always a good idea to check the current eVisa requirements and application process with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro before you travel, as they can change.

NEED AN E-VISA?

How Can I Apply for a Montenegro Regular visa?

To apply for a Montenegro regular visa, you will need to follow these steps:

Check your eligibility: Before you apply for a Montenegro visa, you should check to see if you are eligible. Most nationalities are eligible for a visa, but there are some exceptions.

Gather the required documents: To apply for a Montenegro visa, you will need to provide certain documents, such as a valid passport, a recent passport-size photo, and proof of onward travel. You may also need to provide proof of accommodation and/or proof of sufficient funds.

Fill out the visa application form: You will need to fill out the visa application form, which will ask for personal and travel information, such as your name, date of birth, and the dates of your trip.

Schedule an interview: You may be required to schedule an interview at the Montenegro Embassy or Consulate in your country of residence.

Submit your application: After filling out the visa application form and scheduling an interview, you can submit your application. You should submit your application along with all the required documents, including the application fee, in person at the embassy or consulate.

Wait for approval: After submitting your application, you will need to wait for it to be processed. This can take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks. Once your application is approved, your visa will be issued and you can pick it up from the Embassy or consulate.

It is important to note that the process for obtaining a Montenegro visa can vary depending on the nationality of the applicant and the purpose of their travel. Before traveling, it's a good idea to confirm the most recent requirements for visas and the procedure for applying with the Montenegrin Embassy.

Montenegro evisa types

Montenegro offers several types of eVisas, depending on the purpose of travel and the duration of stay.

The types of eVisas include:

Airport transit (A) for one or several transits, without entry into the territory of Montenegro. This is an airport transit visa and it permits you to pass through the international zone of the airport and travel to another destination outside Montenegro.

Transit (B) issued, This type of eVisa is for travelers who will be passing through Montenegro on their way to another destination and do not plan to leave the airport or seaport. Transit eVisas are valid for one, two, or more transits through the territory of Montenegro.

Short stay visa (C) for one, two, or multiple entries into Montenegro:

Tourist visa

Business visa

Personal or other purposes visas

Long Stay Visa (D) for one, two, or multiple entries for foreigners with a stay of more than 90 days and not more than 6 months in a period of one year for various purposes.

Granting a temporary residence permit is applicable in certain cases. It is issued to foreigners intending to stay longer than 90 days in Montenegro, for the following purposes:

Employment, work and economic or business activity;

Seasonal work;

Secondary education and studies

Participation in student exchange programs or other youth programs

Specialization or professional training

Scientific-research

Medical treatment

Family reunification

Humanitarian reasons

Other justified reasons specified by law or international agreements

Montenegro evisa requirements

To apply for a Montenegro eVisa, you will need to provide the following documents:

A valid passport: Your passport must be valid for at least six months from the date of arrival in Montenegro and have at least one blank page for the visa.

A recent passport-size photo: This must be a recent passport-sized photo, taken against a white background.

Proof of onward travel: You will need to provide proof of onward travel, such as a confirmed flight booking, to show that you will be leaving Montenegro at the end of your stay.

Proof of accommodation: You will need to provide proof of accommodation, such as a hotel booking or a letter of invitation from a host, to show where you will be staying in Montenegro.

Proof of sufficient funds: You will need to provide proof of sufficient funds, such as bank statements, to show that you have enough money to cover your expenses while in Montenegro.

Travel insurance: You will need to provide proof of travel insurance that covers you for the duration of your stay in Montenegro.

Completed application form: You will need to fill out the eVisa application form, which will ask for personal and travel information, such as your name, date of birth, and the dates of your trip.

Payment of the visa fee: You will need to pay the visa fee in order to submit your application.

It is important to note that the requirements for a Montenegro eVisa can vary depending on the nationality of the applicant and the purpose of their travel. It is always a good idea to check the current eVisa requirements and application process with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro before you travel, as they can change.

What type of information has to be filled in Montenegro eVisa?

To fill out the Montenegro eVisa application form, you will need to provide the following information:

Personal information: This includes your name, date of birth, place of birth, and passport information.

Contact information: This includes your address, email address, and phone number.

Travel information: This includes the dates of your trip, the purpose of your visit, and the names and addresses of the places where you will be staying in Montenegro.

Health and security information: This includes questions about your health and any criminal history.

Payment information: This includes your method of payment for the visa fee.

It is important to fill out the form accurately and completely, as any errors or missing information may delay the processing of your application.

It is also important to note that the application form may vary depending on the type of eVisa you are applying for. It is always a good idea to check the current eVisa application process and requirements with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro before you travel, as they can change.

Once you have completed the application form, you will need to pay the visa fee and submit your application. After that, you will need to wait for the processing of your application and receive your eVisa via email.

Process to fill Montenegro evisa Application Form

The process for filling out the Montenegro eVisa application form is as follows:

Go to the official website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro and locate the eVisa application form.

Fill out the form with your personal and travel information, including your name, date of birth, passport information, and the dates of your trip.

Upload a recent passport-size photo, taken against a white background.

Provide proof of onward travel, such as a confirmed flight booking, to show that you will be leaving Montenegro at the end of your stay.

Provide proof of accommodation, such as a hotel booking or a letter of invitation from a host, to show where you will be staying in Montenegro.

Provide proof of sufficient funds, such as bank statements, to show that you have enough money to cover your expenses while in Montenegro.

Provide proof of travel insurance that covers you for the duration of your stay in Montenegro.

Review your application carefully to ensure that all the information is correct and accurate.

Pay the visa fee and submit your application.

It is crucial to complete the form completely and precisely since any mistakes or missing data may cause your application to be processed more slowly. Following completion of the process, you will need to wait while your application is processed before receiving your eVisa through email.

Montenegro evisa cost

The cost of a Montenegro eVisa can vary depending on the type of visa you are applying for and your country of residence. However, currently, the cost for a standard single-entry eVisa for tourism purposes is €30-35 for most countries.

It's always a good idea to check the current eVisa fee with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro before you travel, as they can change over time.

You will be required to pay the eVisa fee with a credit or debit card when you submit your application online. It is important to keep in mind that visa fees are generally non-refundable, even if your application is denied or delayed.

It's also important to note that additional fees may apply for expediting the application process or for certain services like translation or notary fees.

Montenegro evisa Processing time

The processing time for a Montenegro eVisa can vary depending on the time of year and the volume of applications being processed. However, generally speaking, the processing time is usually between 3-5 working days.

It's always a good idea to apply for your eVisa well in advance of your planned travel date to ensure that you have enough time to receive your visa and make any necessary travel arrangements.

It's important to note that the processing time may vary depending on the type of eVisa you are applying for and your country of residence, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro may request additional documentation or an interview in some cases, which can further delay the processing of your application.

Where to apply for Montenegro visa

You can apply for a Montenegro visa through the Embassy or Consulate of Montenegro in your country of residence. It's always a good idea to check the current guidelines and procedures of the Embassy or Consulate of Montenegro in your country of residence, as they can change over time.

You can also check with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro for the list of countries eligible for eVisa, as it's not available for all countries.

You can also apply for a Montenegro eVisa through the official website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Montenegro. The eVisa application process can be completed entirely online, and you will receive your visa via email.

It's important to keep in mind that the Embassy or Consulate of Montenegro in your country of residence may have different requirements, processing times, and fees for visa applications, so it's a good idea to check with them directly for the most up-to-date information.
